title: (x) Break Away logo - Revue, Kaufman {Karl, Chesh}
content:
Can you identify both typefaces? Thanks.   
 ![logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24164.gif)

 [‹ (x) Cowboy Poetry - HTF Hoefler Text {Karl}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2726 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Stewardson - Adobe Sans substitution font {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2712 "Go to next forum topic")
author: nick

comments.content:
[link](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/revue/)   
   
BTW, I don't know the script. Sorry.
In my day, people were able to ID _AND_ link in one post... ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
In my day, I nailed the second ID. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

In communist Russia, type identifies YOU!   
   
...couldn't help it ;)

I don't know if it is worth it but Kaufmann (the original I believe) and [Swing](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/swing/bold/testdrive.html?s=The%2BAlternative%2BBreak%2BConnection&p=36) are so close... but maybe Swing has more [glyphs](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104015745/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=205253) (for example the second lc p from Swing I don't see it in Kauffmann).

That's not a lc 'p' Ignacio, that's the Icelandic character   
whaddayacallit I've got a whole in my brain the size of   
the North Sea from lack of sleep too much work oh no I'm   
losing it talktayalater bye...

Yep: thorn. Brain's not back to optimum working order   
(yet) so please someone put me out of my misery if I   
start jabbering again.
